value.name: .NET Desktop
value.description: Build and test a .NET or Windows classic desktop solution.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the Visual Studio solution file or NuGet packages.config. Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

value.name: Universal Windows Platform
value.description: Build and test a Universal Windows Platform application using Visual Studio.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the solution(s) or MSBuild project to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

value.name: Azure Cloud Services
value.description: Build, package, test, and deploy an Azure Cloud Service.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the solution(s) or MSBuild project to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: CloudServiceProject
inputs.label: Azure service project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the solution(s) or MSBuild project to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription (Classic)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic subscription to target for deployment.

inputs.name: StorageAccount
inputs.label: Storage account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Storage account must exist prior to deployment.

inputs.name: ServiceName
inputs.label: Service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select or enter an existing cloud service name.

inputs.name: ServiceLocation
inputs.label: Service location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a region for new service deployment. Possible options are **East US**, **East US 2**, **Central US**, **South Central US**, **West US**, **North Europe**, **West Europe** and others.

value.name: Azure Web App for ASP.NET
value.description: Build, package, test, and deploy an ASP.NET Azure Web App.

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the solution(s) or MSBuild project to run.  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\*.sln` for all sln files in all sub folders.

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment

inputs.name: WebAppName
inputs.label: App service name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter or select the name of an existing Azure App Service

value.name: Xcode
value.description: Build, test, archive, or package an Xcode workspace on macOS.

inputs.name: xcWorkspacePath
inputs.label: Workspace or project path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a relative path from the root of the repository to the Xcode workspace or project. For example, `MyApp/MyApp.xcworkspace` or `MyApp/MyApp.xcodeproj`.

inputs.name: scheme
inputs.label: Scheme
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a scheme name defined in Xcode. It must be a shared scheme, with its Shared checkbox enabled under Managed Schemes in Xcode. If you specify a Workspace or project path above without specifying a scheme, and the workspace has a single shared scheme, it will be automatically used.

inputs.name: xcodeVersion
inputs.label: Xcode version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the target version of Xcode. Select `Default` to use the default version of Xcode on the agent machine. Selecting a version number (e.g. `Xcode 9`) relies on environment variables being set on the agent machine for the version's location (e.g. `XCODE_9_DEVELOPER_DIR=/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). Select `Specify path` to provide a specific path to the Xcode developer directory.

inputs.name: xcodeDeveloperDir
inputs.label: Xcode developer path
inputs.helpMarkDown: (Optional) Enter a path to a specific Xcode developer directory (e.g. `/Applications/Xcode_9.0.0.app/Contents/Developer`). This is useful when multiple versions of Xcode are installed on the agent machine.

value.name: Empty pipeline
value.description: Start with an empty pipeline and add your own steps.

value.name: Xamarin.Android
value.description: Build an Android app and Xamarin.UITest assembly. Test on real devices with App Center.

inputs.name: restorePkgSolution
inputs.label: Solution to restore packages
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path to the Visual Studio Solution file

inputs.name: appFiles
inputs.label: App File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the files(s).  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\bin\\*.apk` for all APK files in bin subfolder.

value.name: Xamarin.iOS
value.description: Build a Xamarin.iOS app and Xamarin.UITest assembly. Test on real devices with App Center.

inputs.script:
# To manually select a Xamarin SDK version on the Hosted macOS agent, run this script with the SDK version you want to target
# https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=871629 

sudo $AGENT_HOMEDIRECTORY/scripts/select-xamarin-sdk.sh 5_4_1

inputs.name: solution
inputs.label: Solution to build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the Xamarin.iOS solution to build.

inputs.name: appFiles
inputs.label: App File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root of the files(s).  Wildcards can be used.  For example, `**\\bin\\*.apk` for all APK files in bin subfolder.

template.name: Jenkins
template.description: Queue a Jenkins job and download its artifacts.

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Jenkins job to queue.  This must exactly match the job name on the Jenkins server.

inputs.name: serverEndpoint
inputs.label: Jenkins service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service connection for your Jenkins instance.  To create one, click the Manage link and create a new Jenkins service connection.

template.name: Load test using Azure IaaS virtual machines
template.description: Create a rig on Azure IaaS virtual machines to run load tests using VSTS cloud-based load testing service.

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the deployment.

inputs.name: csmFile
inputs.label: Azure template
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the path to the Azure Resource Manager template. For more information about the templates see https://aka.ms/azuretemplates. To get started immediately use template https://aka.ms/sampletemplate.

inputs.name: LoadTest
inputs.label: Load test file
inputs.helpMarkDown: The load test filename to be used under the load test folder specified above.

inputs.name: TestDrop
inputs.label: Load test files folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root where the load test solution build output will be available.

inputs.name: TestSettings
inputs.label: Test settings file
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path from repo root for the test settings file to use for the load test.

template.name: ASP.NET

template.name: ASP.NET Core
template.description: Build and test an ASP.NET Core web application.

inputs.name: RestoreBuildProjects
inputs.label: Project(s) to restore and build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path of the .csproj file(s) from repo root. Wildcards can be used. For example, **/*.csproj for all .csproj files in all the subfolders.

inputs.name: TestProjects
inputs.label: Project(s) to test
inputs.helpMarkDown: Relative path of the .csproj file(s) from repo root. Wildcards can be used. For example, **/*.csproj for all .csproj files in all the subfolders.
